  • Uses of GameEnvironment in commandline

    Methods in commandline with parameters of type GameEnvironment
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    BattleCommandLine.chooseBattle(GameEnvironment env)
    Command line interface for choosing a battle, the possible battles are displayed, and the player can choose to fight one, or exit to the prievious menu, if a battle is fought and one it is removed from the current battles for this day.
    private boolean
    BattleCommandLine.makeMove(GameEnvironment env, Monster enemy)
    Command line interface to make a move, either attacking (attack strings are displayed and one is chosen), using an item (delegated to InventoryCommandLine), switching the currently active monster in your team, or fleeing the battle.
    boolean
    BattleCommandLine.run(GameEnvironment env, boolean isWildBattle, int teamBattleInd)
    Comman line interface to run a battle, runs pre battle logic, each turn with makeMove() and Player.makeRandomMove() and handles the rewards if the player wins the battle.
    (package private) void
    GameOverCommandLine.run(GameEnvironment env)
    Displays the final game information (length, gold, score).
    boolean
    InventoryCommandLine.run(GameEnvironment env)
    Displays the player's inventory and promts the user to return to the prievious menu or use one of the items.
    void
    Main.run(GameEnvironment env)
    Runs each day, displaying information to the player, performing pre day logic, post day logic and within each day taking input to decide which action to take and delegating each action to other classes e.g.
    (package private) void
    ShopCommandLine.run(GameEnvironment env)
    Command line interface for the shop, displaying the player's current gold and the shop's stock, and prompting the user to return to the prievious menu, choose an item to buy, or sell one of their own items or monsters.
    (package private) void
    TeamCommandLine.run(GameEnvironment env)
    Displays each monster in the Player's team, and prompts the user to return to the prievious menu, choose a new monster to be first in the order, or rename one of the monsters.
